be.jonaseveraert.util.progressBar.desktop

Class ProgressBarHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.jonaseveraert.util.progressBar.desktop.ProgressBarHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProgressBarHandler

    public class ProgressBarHandler
extends Object
implements ProgressBarHandler
    Handles a JProgressBar based on sub-processes and activities within that subprocess.

    I have linked a JProgressBar demo from the Java Docs in the see also

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    %I%
    Author:
    Jonas Everaert, jonaseveraert.be
    See Also:
    ProgressBarWindow, JProgressBarDemo from the Java Docs

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProgressBarHandler

        public ProgressBarHandler(JPanel panel)

        Creates a handler that can handle a JProgressBar in a JPanel

        Usage

        setup

        Call the setNumbProcesses method to set the amount of sub processes that need to be completed. This will divide the progress bar in numSubProcesses equal parts.

        After that, the sub-processes need to be initialised. Call the #setNumActivitiesInSubProcesses(subProcessID, numActivities) to set the amount of activities that need to be completed for sub-process subProcessID to be completed. This is used to divide the part of the progressbar that the sub-process takes up into numActivities equal parts.

        Sub-processes also need a name and state. The default state is busy, but it can also be set to done, which will place a "." after the sub-process instead of a "...".

        starting the progress bar

        Before you can do anything with the progress bar, you have to call the startProgressBar method. This method initiates variables and components to start the progress bar and (tries to) show the progress window. It will also set the cursor to busy.

        To get the current progress percentage, call the getProgress method. This can be use to determine if the progressbar has finished externally.

        To complete an activity, call the completeActivity(boolean autoCompleteSubProcess). If the method's boolean value is set to true, it will automatically go to the next sub-process after completing all activities in the sub-process.

        If you want to go to the next sub-process (e.g. not all activities had to be performed, or a sub-process had to be skipped), call the completeSubProcess method. This method is also called if the completeActivity(boolean autoCompleteSubProcess)'s autoCompleteSubProcess value is true. When the process has completely finished, call the completeProcess method. This will reset the cursor and manage other things that have to be done after the progress bar has hit 100% (or if the process has been cancelled).

        Parameters:
        panel - The JPanel containing the JProgressBar and, optionally, the JTextArea that will display the subProcessInfo's subProcessName object.

      • showProgressWindow

        @Deprecated
public void showProgressWindow()
        Deprecated. Use .setVisible on the JFrame instead
        Sets the JPanel's parent visibility. Make sure you already packed your JFrame before executing this method.

public void hideProgressWindow()

        Hides the window instead of closing it (assuming you are using hte JFrame) so the window can be reused for another progress bar

        public void setNumSubProcesses(int numSubProcesses)
        Description copied from interface: ProgressBarHandler
        Sets the amount of sub-processes the process has. e.g. if there are 2 sub-processes, then each of them will take up 50% of the progressbar.
        Specified by:
        setNumSubProcesses in interface ProgressBarHandler
        Parameters:
        numSubProcesses - The number of sub-processes the process has.

      • setNumActivitiesInSubProcesses

        public void setNumActivitiesInSubProcesses(int subProcessID,
                                           int numActivities)
        Description copied from interface: ProgressBarHandler
        Sets the numActivities a sub-process with id subProcessID has. If there are 2 activities in a sub-process, then each activity will take up 50% of the sub-process' part of the progressbar
        Specified by:
        setNumActivitiesInSubProcesses in interface ProgressBarHandler
        Parameters:
        subProcessID - The id of the sub-process (in order from when you added the sub-processes, starting at 0)
        numActivities - number of activities the sub-process subProcessID has

      • setSubProcessInfo

        public void setSubProcessInfo(int subProcessID,
                              String subProcessName,
                              int state)
        Sets the name and the state of the subprocess
        Specified by:
        setSubProcessInfo in interface ProgressBarHandler
        Parameters:
        subProcessID - the id of the subprocess
        subProcessName - the subprocess' name (e.g. Writing file)
        state - the subprocess' state (e.g. busy (= 0) or done (= 1). Used to append "..." or "." to the subprocess' name
